purpose: Produces sex cells and hormones necessary for reproduction.

interfaces.name: Hormonal Regulation
interfaces.description: Receives hormonal signals from endocrine system to regulate reproductive processes. Verified by physiology literature.
interfaces.source_verification: Existing - verified by authoritative sources (NCBI, PubMed)

interfaces.name: Nutrient and Oxygen Supply
interfaces.description: Receives nutrients and oxygen from cardiovascular system for reproductive organ function. Verified by physiology literature.
interfaces.source_verification: Existing - verified by authoritative sources (NCBI, PubMed)

verification_notes: Based on established anatomical and physiological sources.

justification.rationale: Standard anatomical model; all interfaces are well-documented in literature.
justification.examples: Hormonal regulation, nutrient and oxygen supply
